attributes.action: Continue to provide christian single mothers accommodation
attributes.additional_details: Christian Single mother need protection. They should not be forced to sign inclusion agreements. This goes against the ethos of the human rights act.
attributes.background: I am a christain street preacher and i hear stories where christian mothers are being evicted and made homeless because they are christian or disqualified from housing because they are christian. This places them in very vunerable situations. Sleeping in sheds.

rejection.details:
It is already unlawful to discriminate against someone because of religion or belief within the Equality Act 2010. We're therefore not sure what further action you'd like to see the Government or Parliament take. 

You can find information about complaining about housing discrimination on the citizens advice website: https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/housing/discrimination-in-housing/taking-action/complaining-about-housing-discrimination/

You can find information about help available for someone who is homeless or about to become homeless: https://www.gov.uk/if-youre-homeless-at-risk-of-homelessness
